instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no video or chime anymore
threads.message:
I just had a post on here a couple days ago with this board not turning on. Here is the link to it 
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/25072-solved-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-no-green-light-or-s3-s0-rails[/url]

Its been a few days because I had to order another dc-in board for this since my test one doesn't look that great even though it works fine. I put 2 different dc-in boards and put the board in the housing plugged in the battery and everything. When I hit the power button the fans spin but I got no video or chime.

I checked and there was 0v on Pin 1 of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> so no screen is detected.  I even plugged in another known working screen and that didn't work either. 
Here are some measurments I got and things I've tried doing to fix this.
CPU Vcore - 1.15v
<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> voltage - 1.06v
Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 5.4kohms (Dead MCP??? What could cause it to die so soon after working - I tried heating MCP then turning on but that didn't work.)
SMC/PRAM reset
Removed Ram sticks and got beeps
USB Mouse lights up
The DC-IN connector didn't look to great on the <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> pin. I've tried removing Dc-in board and plugging battery in and turning on with keyboard but that still didn't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no video or chime anymore
threads.message: If MCP vcore present? If it is and there is no obvious corrosion I would vote bad MCP79

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no video or chime anymore
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no video or chime anymore
threads.message: I have 1v on MCP vcore so I guess the mcp is the issue. The time when it worked I believe was after it came out of the oven after a cleaning so maybe that's why it turned on.
